name: Memoir Devourer
traits: shares author interviews on social, loves emotional or transformative storytelling, reviews indie life stories
tropes: resilience arc, found voice, overcoming shame
promo_tip: Emphasize authenticity, emotion, and transformation. Frame your memoir as an intimate journey, not just a timeline.

name: Legacy Seeker
traits: interested in generational stories, reads books about family secrets and historical roots
tropes: multi-timeline, family trauma, rediscovered heritage
promo_tip: Highlight generational arcs and emotional resonance. Perfect for stories with flashbacks or family reveals.

name: Self-Help Strategist
traits: tracks mindset shifts in journals, listens to motivational audiobooks, follows productivity YouTubers
tropes: glow-up, identity reinvention, mindset transformation
promo_tip: Use bold, goal-oriented language. Frame your book as a tactical advantage or breakthrough moment.

name: Manifestation Maven
traits: follows vision board trends, uses affirmations, shares spiritual goal-setting routines
tropes: abundance journey, the universe provides, dream big energy
promo_tip: Use energizing language and future-visualization themes. Tie in success stories or reader testimonials.

name: Spiritual Seeker
traits: shares scripture reflections, reviews devotionals, follows Christian influencers
tropes: divine timing, redemption arc, chosen purpose
promo_tip: Lead with peace, light, and spiritual value. Avoid over-marketing; authenticity wins here.

name: Wellness Whisperer
traits: posts meal prep, yoga reels, shares body-mind connection books
tropes: renewal arc, healing journey, inner calm
promo_tip: Use serene imagery and grounding copy. Emphasize personal growth and sustainable change.

name: Spicy Kindle Addict
traits: reads late-night on Kindle Unlimited, follows dark romance authors on TikTok, loves villain love interests
tropes: possessive hero, enemies to lovers, touch her and die
promo_tip: Lead with trope heat and emotional tension. Dark romance readers love morally gray intensity.

name: Fae Court Obsessed
traits: collects special editions, loves court intrigue, ships morally gray magic users
tropes: forbidden bond, fae bargains, chosen one
promo_tip: Use lush language, tension-filled summaries, and emphasize fantasy tropes.

name: True Crime Sleuth
traits: binge-listens to murder podcasts, reads cold case books, follows court drama on TikTok
tropes: justice served, mysterious narrator, victim redemption
promo_tip: Lead with intrigue and real-world relevance. Highlight emotional hooks, especially if based on true events.

name: Romantic Realist
traits: enjoys love stories with grounded emotional arcs, reads second-chance romance, avoids fantasy
tropes: slow burn, emotional scars, mature love
promo_tip: Skip the fluff. Showcase emotional intelligence, relatable flaws, and quiet moments of connection.

name: Queer Worldbuilder
traits: reads indie fantasy with queer leads, critiques worldbuilding depth, active on BookTube
tropes: found family, enemies to lovers, elemental magic
promo_tip: Center character-driven journeys and immersive politics. Bonus points for emotional world stakes.

name: BookTok Trend Hunter
traits: buys books from trending TikToks, shares bookshelf reveal videos, prioritizes aesthetics
tropes: morally gray hero, fake dating, toxic attraction
promo_tip: Use dynamic cover design and bold trope hooks. Lean into what’s hot and emotional.

name: Witchy Wellness Reader
traits: reads about herbalism, moon cycles, spiritual alignment, collects alt wellness zines
tropes: healing magic, shadow work, ancestral rituals
promo_tip: Lean into spiritual healing language and affirm the sacred feminine or nature-based growth.

name: Dark Academia Devotee
traits: loves morally ambiguous narratives, annotates books, posts quote aesthetics
tropes: intellectual obsession, deadly secret, academic rivalry
promo_tip: Use rich prose, gothic tension, and cerebral stakes. Lean into flawed genius characters.

name: History Power Reader
traits: reads historical nonfiction, annotates timelines, shares archive finds
tropes: reclaimed voices, empire critique, origin tracing
promo_tip: Focus on lesser-known facts, social relevance, and layered storytelling. Data meets narrative here.

name: Neurodivergent Daydreamer
traits: immerses in fantasy books as emotional rest, posts sensory-friendly reads, avoids overstimulation
tropes: gentle magic, chosen comfort, quiet resilience
promo_tip: Prioritize emotional safety and gentle pacing. Highlight sensory calm and stable relationships.

name: Faith-Driven Reclaimer
traits: reads inclusive faith-based books, critiques rigid theology, seeks representation in religious nonfiction
tropes: liberation theology, divine healing, reclaiming sacred space
promo_tip: Be honest, grounded, and affirming. Acknowledge pain points while offering hope and connection.

name: Pack Loyalist
tropes: fated mates, alpha protector, rejected mate
traits: adores protective alphas, mate bonds, and pack hierarchy dynamics
promo_tip: Lean into primal tension and loyalty themes. Readers crave emotional intensity and dominance dynamics.

name: YA Enthusiast (Grown)
traits: still reads YA for the nostalgia and angst, collects series hardcovers, reviews on BookTube
tropes: identity discovery, found family, courage vs conformity
promo_tip: Don’t talk down to this reader. Embrace emotion, high stakes, and meaningful growth arcs.

name: Alien Romance Addict
traits: They live for the thrill of otherworldly desire—where the alien is dominant, dangerous, and unexpectedly tender. They crave galaxy-sized stakes wrapped in raw, emotional pull.
tropes: alien hero, touch her and die, captured, language barrier, first contact, fated mates

name: Auctioned but Adored
traits: Obsessed with the trope where Earth women are sold or gifted to powerful alien males—only to be fiercely protected and worshipped. Consent blossoms slowly but steamy.
tropes: alien auction, sold to alien, protective MMC, dubious consent, slow burn, mate bond

name: Alien Softie Seeker
traits: They adore kind, curious aliens who are emotionally intelligent, often unsure of human customs, and fall hard for strong Earth women.
tropes: gentle alien, language barrier, cultural misunderstanding, emotional bond, domestic scenes

name: Rebel Space Bride
traits: Drawn to fierce heroines who are taken to space but refuse to be owned. Loves romance with political intrigue, rebellion, or cultural tension.
tropes: reluctant mate, alien war, rebellion, royal bloodline, fighter heroine, arranged match

name: First Contact Thrill-Seeker
traits: They love stories where the first meeting between human and alien feels dangerous, awe-inspiring, and intimate. Mystery + biology + instant chemistry = obsession.
tropes: first contact, alien anatomy, stranger in a strange land, slow trust, telepathy, star-crossed

name: Shifter Fanatic
traits: They can’t resist a beastly protector hiding beneath the surface. Animal instinct, pack loyalty, and the ache of claiming their mate? Yes, please.
tropes: wolf shifter, snake shifter, fated mates, possessive MMC, marking, found family

name: Alpha Obsession Reader
traits: They crave powerful, dominant shifters who protect what's theirs. If he growls, stalks, and marks his mate as his own, they're hooked.
tropes: alpha male, territorial, touch her and die, bite marks, instinct-driven love

name: Pack-Loyal Romantic
traits: They enjoy the deep-rooted culture of shifter packs, with themes of loyalty, found family, and hierarchy. A strong heroine who earns her place is their vibe.
tropes: pack dynamics, heir to alpha, outsider heroine, rising through the ranks, bonded loyalty

name: Forbidden Shift Seeker
traits: They love when a shifter love is taboo—cross-species, rival packs, or hidden identities. High stakes, high steam, and impossible choices.
tropes: forbidden love, enemy shifters, secret mate, underworld rules, rival clans

name: Mythical Shifter Dreamer
traits: Not just wolves—give them dragons, snakes, phoenixes, and rare creatures. They love mystical lore, elemental ties, and fate-driven love stories.
tropes: rare shifter, snake shifter, mythology, fated mates, prophecy, soul bond

name: Dark Romance Devotee
traits: They want danger laced with desire. Power imbalances, obsession, taboo, and emotional chaos? If it's a little twisted and a lot intense, they're all in.
tropes: captor/captive, touch her and die, mafia, dominant MMC, dubious consent, vengeance

name: Possessive Psycho Lover
traits: The more obsessed and morally gray the MMC, the better. They eat up stalker romance, dark billionaires, and antiheroes who burn the world for her.
tropes: obsession, stalker hero, manipulation, alpha villain, dark billionaire, consent struggle

name: Taboo Line Walker
traits: They want stories that flirt with the forbidden. Age gaps, teacher/student, stepbrother, or captive dynamics—anything that challenges norms but delivers intense emotional payoff.
tropes: age gap, forbidden love, stepbrother, teacher, power imbalance, forgive the unforgivable

name: Trauma Bonded Believer
traits: They crave high-stakes emotional survival. Kidnapping, war, betrayal, addiction—anything that breaks characters down before building them up in passion.
tropes: trauma, healing through love, unreliable narrator, revenge arc, redemption, PTSD

name: Cottagecore Magic Lover
traits: They want gentle magic, herbal spells, and cozy cottages filled with warmth and wonder. Think found family, enchanted teapots, and quiet power.
tropes: hearth magic, found family, gentle witch, village charm, magical home, slow burn

name: Warm Witch Vibes Only
traits: They’re here for witchy vibes without the doom and gloom. Give them healing crystals, local covens, and a black cat who definitely talks.
tropes: modern witch, cozy coven, seasonal magic, light spells, quirky familiars

name: Cursed but Comforted
traits: They adore a light curse plot—where a mild magical mishap leads to laughter, lessons, and maybe love. Bonus points for enchanted books or bakeries.
tropes: charmed objects, cursed hero, slow enchantment, baking magic, library spells

name: Paranormal with a Wink
traits: They love a supernatural world that's more charming than chilling. Ghosts, shifters, or fae in small towns with a touch of sass, not scares.
tropes: ghost roommate, quirky shifter, low stakes, supernatural comedy, soft banter, sweet hauntings

name: True Crime Truth Seeker
traits: They devour real-world cases with obsession-level detail. Crime scene analysis, survivor stories, and psychological breakdowns keep them turning pages into the night.
tropes: real case, unsolved, investigative journalism, forensic detail, survivor POV, serial killers

name: Domestic Suspense Junkie
traits: They love stories where the biggest threat is already inside the house. Give them chilling marriages, missing wives, and secrets buried under suburbia.
tropes: gaslighting, unreliable narrator, hidden past, woman in peril, suburban horror, murder cover-up

name: Cold Case Cracker
traits: They live for long-buried secrets finally coming to light. Whether it’s a journalist, a cop, or an amateur sleuth—if the past comes back to haunt, they’re here for it.
tropes: cold case, family secrets, old diary, DNA twist, timeline jumps, buried evidence

name: Memoir Empath
traits: They crave real stories with emotional grit. Whether it’s overcoming trauma, finding voice, or surviving against the odds—they’re here to feel it all.
tropes: trauma, identity, healing, survivor story, motherhood, voice reclamation

name: Soul-Stirred Lit Lover
traits: They read for beauty, ache, and nuance. Quiet domestic scenes, generational stories, and poetic prose speak louder than plot.
tropes: grief, family saga, quiet tension, elegant writing, emotional clarity, introspective POV

name: Memoir of the Margins Seeker
traits: They seek voices that haven’t been centered—Black, queer, immigrant, neurodiverse, disabled. Real stories from real lives with layered, lived-in truths.
tropes: diaspora, racial identity, intersectionality, activism, injustice, unheard voices

name: Hustle & Systems Thinker
traits: They geek out over optimization, automation, and turning side hustles into empires. If it’s lean, scalable, and time-saving—they're clicking ‘Buy.’
tropes: workflow, startup life, efficiency, passive income, systems building, founder mindset

name: Purpose-Driven Leader
traits: They crave clarity, impact, and vision. Strategy is cool, but legacy is everything. They gravitate toward books that blend business with personal evolution.
tropes: vision, branding, inspiration, legacy, storytelling, company culture

name: Micro-Habit Master
traits: They’re obsessed with changing their life one tiny action at a time. If it’s backed by neuroscience or behavioral research, even better.
tropes: habit stacking, atomic habits, behavioral science, consistency, goal setting, daily rituals

name: Found Family Seeker
traits: They long for characters who build their own tribe when the world lets them down. Bonds formed in fire, grief, or rebellion are what stick.
tropes: found family, chosen family, group dynamics, loyalty, outsiders, ride-or-die

name: Academy Obsessionist
traits: They live for elite schools, magic classes, and rivals-turned-lovers. If there’s danger in the dorm and drama in the dark hallways, they’re sold.
tropes: magical academy, secret society, enemies to lovers, forbidden powers, deadly trials

name: Trauma + Triumph Tracker
traits: They want raw, real journeys—teens overcoming grief, abuse, addiction, or loss. They stay for the scars, and cheer loudest for the growth.
tropes: trauma, mental health, survivor, therapy arc, healing, resilience

name: Fantasy Destiny Devourer
traits: Give them prophecies, ancient magic, and a teen who has no idea they’re the key to saving the realm. High fantasy + heart? Say less.
tropes: hidden power, reluctant hero, quest, royal blood, magical creature, epic stakes

name: Dystopian Diehard
traits: They still reread *The Hunger Games* and *Divergent* like it's gospel. Rebellion, survival, and morally gray choices? Yes. Please.
tropes: totalitarian regime, secret rebellion, chosen one, deadly game, underground network

name: First Love Loyalist
traits: They want the awkward, sweet, painful, or perfect magic of first love. Every glance, every brush of hands, every heartbreak counts.
tropes: first kiss, love triangle, high school crush, slow burn, bittersweet ending

name: Supernatural Coming-Out Crew
traits: They love when magical powers mirror real-world identity struggles. Monsters, magic, or mystery becomes the lens for self-discovery.
tropes: secret identity, monster metaphor, coming out, acceptance, internal magic

name: Quietly Powerful Reader
traits: They lean toward quiet books that pack a punch. Emotional nuance, small town tension, and prose that hits like poetry.
tropes: grief, family secrets, small town, summer shift, quiet main character, soft prose

name: Competition Arc Enthusiast
traits: They thrive on tournaments, training arcs, and merit-based glory. Whether magical or musical—someone’s gotta earn their place.
tropes: training montage, deadly tournament, talent show, rival romance, underdog rise

name: Time-Bender Explorer
traits: They crave timelines, memories, or alternate universes twisted just enough to spark existential chills. Emotional and mind-bending—always.
tropes: time loop, alternate reality, memory wipe, parallel worlds, soulmates across lifetimes

name: Recipe Ritualist
traits: They read cookbooks like devotionals. Ingredients are spells, and the kitchen is sacred. They love lush photos, seasonal guides, and ritual-based cooking.
tropes: slow food, seasonal, ritual, kitchen magic, meal prep, mindful cooking

name: Global Flavor Hunter
traits: They want cookbooks that take them on a journey—Thai street food, North African spices, or Korean BBQ. Cultural context + bold flavors = a must.
tropes: international recipes, street food, regional cuisine, travel stories, bold spice

name: Culinary Simplifier
traits: They want it fast, forgiving, and still delicious. One-pan meals, 5 ingredients, or weeknight winners—they collect the hacks, not the hassle.
tropes: easy meals, quick recipes, family-friendly, meal prep, budget cooking, no-fuss

name: Off-the-Grid Dreamer
traits: They’re drawn to gruff men in isolated cabins who reluctantly fall for the one person who crashes into their peace—and steals their heart.
tropes: grumpy/sunshine, off grid, cabin fever, forced proximity, reluctant hero

name: Protective Recluse Fangirl
traits: They melt for the emotionally wounded loner who becomes fiercely protective. He growls, builds furniture, and protects her with his life.
tropes: protective MMC, backwoods alpha, trauma recovery, danger in the woods, slow thaw

name: Cabin Heat Seeker
traits: They’re here for the heat—and the hearth. The moment snow traps them together, sparks fly, shirts come off, and secrets unravel.
tropes: snowed in, one bed, body heat, fireplace scenes, emotional isolation

name: Mountain Wife Manifestor
traits: They dream of homestead love—chopping wood, raising goats, and growing closer under the stars. The fantasy is survival + soulmates.
tropes: homesteading, healing romance, quiet love, small town, intentional living

name: Monster Lover Loyalist
traits: They love the truly monstrous—tentacles, fangs, claws—and the primal devotion these creatures give to the ones they claim.
tropes: nonhuman MMC, body worship, monster anatomy, touch her and die, instinctual mate

name: Monster Softie Collector
traits: They want monstrous shells and golden hearts—creatures who scare the world but would die to keep their mate safe and loved.
tropes: gentle monster, found love, comfort kink, emotional bond, unusual pairing

name: Consent-Obsessed Creature Craver
traits: They’re in it for the possessive yet respectful monster who makes consent sexy, sacred, and steaming. Bonus points for rituals and scenting.
tropes: obsessed MMC, verbal consent, scent kink, mate ritual, mutual worship

name: Cryptid Chaos Addict
traits: Give them weird. Mothman, kraken, cursed forest gods—they want strange, seductive, and slightly unhinged monster matches.
tropes: mothman, cursed forest, weirdcore, feral MMC, alt-lore, tentacles

name: Emotional Angst Devourer
traits: They’re here for slow burns, near-misses, and aching glances. High emotional payoff, queer identity themes, and longing fuel their fire.
tropes: slow burn, internal conflict, coming out, pining, hurt/comfort, found family

name: Spicy But Soft Reader
traits: They want heat, yes—but paired with tenderness, humor, and full-body emotional intimacy. No toxic love—just deep connection and steam.
tropes: banter, friends to lovers, touch-starved, mutual teasing, bedroom warmth, safe space

name: Age-Gap or Power Shift Lover
traits: They’re drawn to dynamic imbalance—teacher/student, older-younger, boss/employee—handled with heart and depth, not just kink.
tropes: age gap, power play, mentor romance, taboo-ish, emotional evolution

name: Fated Mates, Queer Edition
traits: They love soulmate tropes and otherworldly bonds—with two men destined to collide through magic, prophecy, or primal attraction.
tropes: shifter mates, magical bond, soul-deep attraction, prophecy, claiming

name: Dragon Lite Believer
traits: enjoys shifters who feel almost human—gentle, emotionally aware, often hiding their strength
tropes: dragon shifter, emotional bond, misunderstood power, healing connection
promo_tip: Frame the dragon as mythic but humanized—readers want heart, not horror.

name: Latinx Lawman Lover
traits: reads bilingual romantic suspense, loves protective heroes in uniform with cultural depth
tropes: single dad cop, second chance, community protector
promo_tip: Center emotional warmth and community strength. Bonus for Spanish phrases and family ties.

name: Queer Mafia Craver
traits: wants dangerous romance with gay leads—mob drama, emotional scars, and forbidden loyalty
tropes: bratva enforcer, undercover lover, forbidden romance
promo_tip: Lean into power imbalance and emotional vulnerability. Queer mafia readers want layered tension.

name: Black Mountain Bride
traits: adores rustic romance with Black leads, healing after heartbreak, and small-town tenderness
tropes: single mom, slow burn, emotional rescue, quiet strength
promo_tip: Highlight gentle masculinity and nature’s role in healing. Readers want peace after pain.

name: Burnout Recovery Buff
traits: reads about rest, nervous system regulation, and escaping hustle culture
tropes: quiet healing, burnout to balance, body-first success
promo_tip: Position your book as relief—not another task. Frame ease and recovery as strengths.

name: Boundary Builder
traits: reads self-help on saying no, escaping people-pleasing, and reclaiming time
tropes: emotional clarity, found voice, relationship detox
promo_tip: Use confident, affirming tone. Focus on reclaiming peace, not shaming readers.

name: Disability Justice Reader
traits: reads about systemic accessibility, lived experience, and radical inclusion
tropes: own voice, advocacy, redefining independence
promo_tip: Use clear, respectful language. Center lived experience and social insight.

name: Creative Biz Dreamer
traits: reads business books tailored to artists, authors, and solopreneurs
tropes: brand clarity, slow success, passion to profit
promo_tip: Speak to creative spirits. Position your book as a roadmap with warmth, not pressure.

name: Grief-Work Gazer
traits: reads memoirs and psychology books about loss, mourning, and emotional healing
tropes: grief arc, love after loss, mother wound
promo_tip: Lead with softness and realness. Readers are processing; be a companion, not a guide.

name: Queer Love Memoirist
traits: seeks real-life stories of queer identity, coming out, and chosen love
tropes: self-discovery, public vs private, love as liberation
promo_tip: Use personal truth as your power. Readers seek resonance over perfection.

name: Neurodivergent Systems Seeker
traits: loves frameworks that reduce chaos—calendar blocking, sensory mapping, executive function hacks
tropes: mind-body syncing, ADHD management, peace through structure
promo_tip: Clarity is king. Show, don’t lecture—visually structured books win big here.

name: Liberation Theology Seeker
traits: reads radical Christian works centered on justice, deconstruction, and spiritual liberation
tropes: sacred rage, reclaiming scripture, holy resistance
promo_tip: Lead with empathy and insight. These readers want courage wrapped in grace.

name: Millennial Midlife Reflector
traits: reads about aging, shifting identity, and relationships after 35
tropes: career pivot, motherhood reimagined, divorce and rediscovery
promo_tip: Position your book as a mirror and map. Readers want to feel seen in flux.

name: Quiet Power Builder
traits: prefers introvert-friendly business guides, slow marketing, and authentic influence
tropes: quiet branding, deep work, soft scaling
promo_tip: Avoid hustle hype. Speak to sustainable impact and calm confidence.

name: Persona 1
tropes: sample trope, emotional core, genre hook
promo_tip: Write emotionally compelling content that appeals to readers who seek depth.
